Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. *Find sources:* "Bukit Gombak Stadium" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(February 2019)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)* 1°21′29.71″N 103°45′12.67″E﻿ / ﻿1.3582528°N 103.7535194°E﻿ / 1.3582528; 103.7535194 The **Bukit Gombak Stadium** is located in [Bukit Gombak](/wiki/Bukit_Gombak), [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore), and has a capacity of 3,000 people. Bukit Gombak Stadium is mostly used for [football](/wiki/Football_(soccer)) matches and its operated by [Sport Singapore](/wiki/Sport_Singapore). It is located next to the [Bukit Gombak MRT station](/wiki/Bukit_Gombak_MRT_station). ## History Bukit Gombak Stadium was home to football club, [Gombak United](/wiki/Gombak_United_FC) in the [S.League](/wiki/S-league) before they left the league in the year of 2002. Thereafter, the stadium was converted to a Centre of Excellence for the Singapore Athletic Association. In October 2019, [Senegal national football team](/wiki/Senegal_national_football_team) consisted of world class players such as [Sadio Mané](/wiki/Sadio_Man%C3%A9), [Kalidou Koulibaly](/wiki/Kalidou_Koulibaly), [Ismaïla Sarr](/wiki/Isma%C3%AFla_Sarr), [Cheikhou Kouyaté](/wiki/Cheikhou_Kouyat%C3%A9) and [Keita Baldé](/wiki/Keita_Bald%C3%A9) was also involved as Senegal use the Bukit Gombak Stadium as its training base. In May 2025, Emirati club [Sharjah FC](/wiki/Sharjah_FC) use the Bukit Gombak Stadium as its training base in preparation for the upcoming [AFC Champions League Two](/wiki/AFC_Champions_League_Two) final. ## Facilities and Structures Bukit Gombak Stadium houses a grass football pitch, an 8-lane running track and partial athletic facilities. People can be seen running around the track daily as Sport Singapore allows joggers to use the track facilities between 4:30am to 9:30pm for free. ## Transport Bukit Gombak Sport Centre is strategically located beside the Bukit Gombak MRT, and next to the scenic Little Guilin Park. With a good mix of young and old residents, the SRC has built a steady take up rate for her Learn-to-Play programmes and for the use of the stadium and gym. ## International fixtures Women's football DateCompetitionTeamScoreTeam25 November 2025[Friendly](/wiki/Friendly_(football)) [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore_women%27s_national_football_team)9–0 [Seychelles](/wiki/Seychelles_women%27s_national_football_team)28 November 2025 [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore_women%27s_national_football_team)7–0 [Seychelles](/wiki/Seychelles_women%27s_national_football_team) This article about a [Singaporean](/wiki/Singapore) sports venue is a stub.
